page.title: 09Bexhill-History of Tourism 2
page.content: As airlines like BOAC grew, Bexhill slowly deteriorated. So grew the saying that people come to Bexhill to die, and Bexhill lost its{tourist {industry.}Now all that is left are a few small hotels, guest houses and bed & breakfast places. Those hotels left do very well. Now, in 1985, the {day tripper}has taken over. The day tripper brings his own food to spend a day on the{beach.}These people are bad for the industry as they spend very little. Another tourist industry has grown up over the past few years. The{foreign {students}have arrived in their thousands. They spend money and buy goods unlike the day tripper but stay in peoples private houses unlike the real holidaymaker.
